page.title: 01General Review
page.content: This rich farming area 8km South of Bristol contains isolated farmsteads, the dispersed village of Ridgehill, and some of Winford and Chew Stoke. Farms are large and mainly rear dairy cattle with sheep and some arable crops. Cider making is a farm activity, the apples being picked from small orchards in the area. Patches of deciduous woodland add to the variety in the landscape. Disused quarries reflect past industry but today the Avon Livestock Centre is of regional importance. A garage, inn, glass firm and farm shops complete the services available. Those inhabitants not employed in agriculture or services in nearby villages may commute to employment in Bristol, and this is reflected in housing development in the South of Winford.
